citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
Four out of fourteen protocols reviewed did not provide sufficient written detail and descriptions of planned animal
activities to allow for a complete review of proposed activities by the IACUC to ensure humane care and use of animals. A
protocol deviation was discovered on Dec 12, 2024 where guinea pigs were subjected to activities that were not included
on their current protocol. Reporting, investigation, and corrective actions and monitoring were implemented for this
protocol.
Lack of completeness in protocols can lead to an incomplete review of the proposed activity by the IACUC and can lead
to lack of clarity about what is allowed as approved activity.
Proposed protocols must contain sufficient detail and clarity of animal care and use activity to allow the IACUC to conduct
a thorough review of all proposed activities.
To be corrected by 10/1/2025.
A focused inspection of AALAC accredited areas and a routine inspection of non-AALAC areas was conducted.
The exit interview was conducted with facility representative.
